triples.name: Reinforcement learning
triples.relevance: The paper applies reinforcement learning algorithms to develop Dreamer for solving control tasks.

triples.name: Deep reinforcement learning
triples.relevance: The paper leverages deep RL techniques to learn from raw pixel inputs in complex environments.

triples.name: Convolutional neural network
triples.relevance: Neural network architectures used to process visual input from the environment in pixel-based learning.

triples.name: Markov decision process
triples.relevance: The mathematical framework underlying reinforcement learning for modeling sequential decision-making.

triples.name: World model
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a world model-based approach where the agent learns and uses an environment model to imagine future scenarios.

triples.name: Policy gradient method
triples.relevance: Technique used for training agents to optimize their policy for improved decision-making.

triples.name: Exploration-exploitation dilemma
triples.relevance: The paper addresses the fundamental challenge of balancing exploration and exploitation in learning across diverse tasks.

triples.name: Minecraft
triples.relevance: The challenging benchmark task used to demonstrate Dreamer's ability to collect diamonds from scratch in a complex open world.

triples.name: Batch normalization
triples.relevance: Normalization technique applied as part of the robustness techniques enabling stable learning across different domains.

triples.name: Feature scaling
triples.relevance: Normalization technique used as a robustness method to ensure stable learning across diverse task domains.
